attributes.action: Ensure corona vaccines administered abroad are fully recognised by NHS
attributes.additional_details:
At present the NHS only recognises Corona vaccines administered in the UK and as a result those whom have had the vaccine abroad are subject to different isolation rules. This is inexcusable given that the information is electronic and can easily be verified and updated on their system. Not doing so is 
both descriminatory and is impacting many UK citizens lives. Ensuring this is done will help the economy by reducing the people needlessly having to self isolate upon being a COVID contact.
attributes.background: To ensure, by law, that the NHS fully recognises and registers vaccinations administered abroad by updating their system to give COVID passes to those whom have had their vaccines elsewhere.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Recognise vaccine doses administered in foreign countries for Covid Pass: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/592505
